Positive Reviews: The location was great as it was within walking distance to everything we wanted to do. The hotel is very clean and I love the history and architecture of the building. The hotel staff are exceptionally kind and helpful. I loved the restaurant and bar area in the lobby

The hairdryer has bot been cleaned in ages - you can tell from the hair that clumped up at the other end, so I did not use it either.
Positive Reviews: It is conveniently located in downtown right next to the King subway, within walking distance to Dundas Square. The hotel also offers early baggage drop-off upon arrival and baggage storage after check-out free of charge. Free wifi, kitchenette, microwave oven, washer/drier etc.

Negative Reviews:
Booked a â€˜historic superior suiteâ€™ was v underwhelmed by first impression. Room not as big as expected. Old fashioned decor, bathroom v small, no bath despite ref pics on website having a bath.

Negative Reviews: Intermittent internet, no cookware and not much crockery in the kitchen, more old-fashioned than in the photos (perhaps only some rooms have been recently refurbished), received twice-daily text messages advertising the hotel cafe/bar, and the in-room safe was not attached in the cupboard.
Positive Reviews: Great view from floor 43, nice pillows, lots of cupboards, room and bathroom reasonably spacious and all clean, room had a washing machine and tumble dryer (only some have these), very convenient location on subway line 1 and 504 King streetcar, and within 10 minutes walk from Union station.

Negative Reviews:
There was no welcome pack for the kitchenette - sponge, tea towel, washing machine supplies.

Casting to the TVs in the room was very unreliable.
Positive Reviews: The location was great. I loved the kitchenette and washing machine in the room and the gym facilities.

Review Title: Great hotel in the center of Toronto (tower rooms a plus)
Negative Reviews: Double beds in our historic suite were not so large for a couple. Kitchen was missing some utensils (we were 3 but we only had utensils for 2). We were able to request more without issues though. We also didn't have enough towels for 3 guests (we could request more but sometimes housekeeping would forget to leave 3 on some days). Would be great to keep in mind room occupancy when prepping/cleaning the rooms.
Positive Reviews: Great location. Despite bed size issues, beds were very comfortable. Kitchenette was well equipped. Great to have a washer/dryer available (a definite plus for a long stay) although the dryer didn't dry completely. The historical suite was cozy. We requested an upgrade to a Tower room for the last few days (going from the 8th floor to the 47th). Well worth the extra costs. We had views of the east side and the lake. Also had separate bed room from the living space with a sofa bed. The bed was super large and very comfortable. The tower is definitely worth a visit again.

Review Title: good, but would think of alternatives for next time.
Negative Reviews:
ensure u DO NOT move your car if u chose the indigo concourse parking- it doesnâ€™t state on info the hotel sends you or on indigo portal until you get a confirmation that in-out is not allowed!
purchased 2 days parking and as it was raining and husband dropped me off 1/2 k down the road 14 hours later - we lost all parking privileges and payment for remainder of visit.  Hotel did offer a room upgrade but we were already settled in. hotel did not offer parking unless we wanted to pay another 55. (+tip) for valet parking.
Positive Reviews: clean, professional. historic elevators information and location not given at check in and this caused us at least 1/2 hr to get to room.

Negative Reviews: The room had a small kitchen with utensils, cups and plates. The wine glasses had lipstick stain and there was no dish soap and sponge to rewash the glasses that were supposed to be clean. The check in and the elevator line was very long  because of covid. Only two people per elevator, there are 4 elevators and the building is more than 50 floors.
Positive Reviews: Booked the Tower Deluxe Suite room. The views of the city and lake was fantastic. I would come back just for the view again.  It was spacious modern interior, had coffee machine, kettle, two TVs, plates, utensil etc.

Review Title: Overall a good hotel and location

Positive Reviews: Size of room was better that expected along with general in-room and kitchenette facilities. The central location and access to the underground PATH system was a bonus as well.

Review Title: Clean comfortable spacious room in excellent location.
Negative Reviews: Our room was initially oddly shaped and a little dark.  Having booked for a "light, bright, spacious suite", the front desk agreed to check us into a new room without issue which was ready soon after.

Negative Reviews: Wifi wasnâ€™t great in the room,
Positive Reviews:
Amazing view

Positive Reviews:

Negative Reviews: No parking, valet only. Room was very dated. Bed sunken in the middle. Shower and bathroom showing itâ€™s age. This is most certainly a midline hotel. I wouldnâ€™t pay more than $250 for a night.
Positive Reviews:
Location is ideal, lobby is nice. Elevator is fast. Room
A/c and heat worked well and was great white noise for sleeping.

Review Title: Great location and nice room but there were some important details that were missed.
Negative Reviews:
The room had not had a good cleaning for a while. There were greasy and even sticky light switches and grease stains on some of the walls. It was a little unsettling considering the extra cleaning that is claimed to be happening due to the pandemic. 
Also there was a very bright light from the internet router that was installed right above the bed. The bright light made it almost impossible for me to sleep. It was too high up to reach to cover it with something. 
When we arrived there was very loud music in the lobby and with the masks and plexiglass it was extremely hard to understand the receptionist. We heard almost nothing she said. This was frustrating.
Positive Reviews: The location is excellent, right downtown and you can walk to everything. The room was spacious and had a nice view.

Negative Reviews: Wifi wasn't good enough to work from the hotel room
Positive Reviews: Excellent location. Spacious room with a great city view.

Review Title: A beautiful building and location, only very let down by the lack of care.
Negative Reviews:
Unfortunately, there was water damage in the hallway before our room, and a fan/dryer was used for the time of our stay that was extremely loud and constant, night and day. We weren't offered any kind of compensation or even warned of the situation and how it might affect our stay. We also had maintenance occur during our stay and the only heads up was through a letter left in front of our door (On the day the work was to be done), so on the day they came, we didn't know they were coming until they arrived at the door. Finally, and a much smaller issue, bathroom was dated and there was no shower gel or dressing gowns available for use in the room.
There was also an extremely loud lobby, which normally wouldn't be a problem, only there was no-where to go for a quiet chat or catch-up - More of a personal preference than a problem with the hotel itself.
Positive Reviews: The checking in process was swift and hassle free. The room was clean and spacious, with a stunning view.

Review Title: Good location, not a fan of the beds
Negative Reviews: My husband and I didnâ€™t like the beds, mainly the fact that one person has to climb in from the bottom of the bed, as the wall or kitchen cupboard is against the other side of the bed meaning itâ€™s a bit squashed when the two of you are in it and there is no where else to go or to have somewhere to put items. Iâ€™ve not seen a set up like that before and started to wonder if Iâ€™d booked the wrong room but at over Â£300 per night Iâ€™d have hoped the beds would have been able to get in/out both sides. The bathroom also doesnâ€™t have a lot of room around the sink for items such as deodorant, toothbrushes etc, the room was clean but felt a bit run down/dark
Positive Reviews: The location is good, itâ€™s not far from the financial district or the Eaton centre or CN tower. It is already connected to the Path system underground so if itâ€™s very hot outside you can get to where you wish to go. Stayed in the historic part of the building which had interesting information around the walls. It is a well equipped suite with a microwave, fridge, two hobs, washing machine. Lots of charging points, safe, and bathroom with both a shower and seperate bath tub. It has air conditioning which is not too noisy either considering itâ€™s the old part.

Review Title: would definitely recommend and stay here again ðŸ‘ðŸ¼
Negative Reviews: small towels
Positive Reviews: Great friendly staff, beautiful lobby and hotel building, clean and comfortable rooms. Great location!

Review Title: Give yourself time to get to your room, but otherwise great
Negative Reviews: The lobby area on check in was crowded and chaotic.  Ppl didn't know where to line up causing conflict between guests,  and the check in process took way too long.... 10-15 minutes per person,  with only 3 desks open on a Friday evening.  Then had to wait 10 minutes for the elevator
Positive Reviews: Great room , high end finishings,  has kitchenette and lots of space.   Good location,  very helpful staff. The attached Cafe was great.

Negative Reviews: On-site parking at $60 a night plus taxes. We parked across the street underground for $50 for the weekend ...2 nights.
Positive Reviews: Everything! Location, staff, quality, cleanliness, rooms, bar, best price and value in Toronto!!

Review Title: One of the best places I have been to. And Canada is simply a great country)
Negative Reviews: The only downside of this hotel was quite unstable Internet (sometimes): one hour it is rapid speed, and in a minute, it may start dropping, or even losing a connection. And that was not about the wifi coverage (which was stable), but specifically about the network provider that is used by the hotel. Major issues were observed mainly in the morning.
Positive Reviews:
Exceptional place to stay in downtown Toronto. The room was spacious, clean, with an exceptional view of the city. All necessities were provided, the staff was extremely friendly and helpful, willing to address any possible questions. Free toiletries, shampoo and even mouthwash - all of high quality brands. Overall, the room felt very fresh (renovated, at least), same as the hotel.
I should also mention the location: it is in the heart of the downtown and all possible local attractions from the list "what to see in Toronto" apparently were within 10-15 minutes of walking: CN tower, distillery, market, city hall, etc. There are nice parking options (look for underground parking lots with daily rates)around this hotel too. And the view - I was living on the 33rd floor (they even offered an upgrade to a higher floor - the building is approx. 50-floor tall - but I decided to go with the option I have chosen), and you can't beat it. It is so beautiful at night!
Overall, I was just impressed with my stay, and it definitely exceeded my expectations! Highly recommend this place.

Review Title: Nice place to stay in a central Toronto downtown area
Negative Reviews: Bar area was crowded and noisy.
Positive Reviews: Central location. Fast elevators. Good housekeeping service. Kitchenette in the room.

Review Title: Good hotel in a great location
Negative Reviews: Not much not to like, the kitchenette could have been better stocked and the towels are a bit small, but otherwise a good hotel.
Positive Reviews: The location is great and the facilities good. The beds are comfortable and the staff are friendly and very helpful.

Negative Reviews: Elevators were very slow and limited.
Positive Reviews: Hotel rooms were spacious and clean, staff was fantastic to deal with. Location was perfect for travelling to Toronto.

Review Title: I loved my stay at 1 king, the hotel was amazing, the hotel view was perfect, honestly this might be my new go to hotel
Negative Reviews: the hotel had parking but it was like $50 per night and the recommended parking lot thatâ€™s next to the hotel had weird parking rates on specific time to leave, doesnâ€™t allow for in and out entry. honestly the only think that could of made everything magical is the parking situation.
Positive Reviews: everything, everything, everything the views, the location, the friendly staff, whenever we called for service they responded fast, the rooms where comfortable and spacious, and excellent view of the city and water. The room had a little kitchen with, dishwasher, microwave, AND WASHER AND DRYER. felt like a little studio.

Review Title: Fantastic Customer Service Elevates a Stay from Good to Great
Negative Reviews: The only thing that could have improved this stay would have been time to extend it. This was a flawless visit and a pleasure all the way. (As always, make sure you leave enough time to catch an elevator if you've got someplace to be  -- physical distancing and a tall tower can mean a wait of several minutes to get to the lobby)
Positive Reviews: I've spent many satisfying nights in downtown Toronto and One King West is one of my favourites places to stay for its excellent location, staff and atmosphere. The fabulous customer service I received from Dipali (night manager) during my recent stay made for the best experience I've ever had at this property. Good rooms, facilities and amenities are expected when you stay at a higher end hotel, but there is no substitute for superlative customer service. Thank you Dipali for making me feel appreciated and at home; I look forward to my next stay ready.

Review Title: Great views, great staff, great location but long elevator wait
Negative Reviews: The wait for the elevators could be quite long during peak hours - it took me 30min+ one time for a quick trip to the Shoppers on the opposite side of the street!
Positive Reviews: Fantastic location with underground connections directly to Union Station and Eaton Centre. The hotel was able to accommodate our request and gave us a room with fabulous views of the city and Lake Ontario. We had some issues with wifi and noise - staff was able to provide resolutions quickly so it has been great!

Review Title: Great stay in Historic Downtown Toronto within easy walking distance of all of the major attractions
Negative Reviews: Not enough selection of pots / pans for cooking.  There was a dishwasher in the kitchenette but no dishwasher capsules / washing up liquid or any tea towels for drying up plates / dishes etc.
Positive Reviews: Great location, historic building, very friendly and helpful staff, good size rooms with excellent facilities.  Perfect for a business stay or a weekend getaway.  I will definitely stay again.

Review Title: One of the best in downtown.
Negative Reviews: Two out of four elevators were not working in the lobby so I had to wait for long for other elevators. Sometimes, Wifi is slow.
Positive Reviews: Clean, spacious room and loo. Comfy and clean bed. Nice city view from the window. Warm and friendly staff. Quiet ambience on the roomsâ€™ floor. Close to tourist sites.

Review Title: great place in Toronto to stay
Negative Reviews: very busy in lobby
Positive Reviews: location, spacious rooms, staff

Review Title: Great stay in a beautiful hotel despite some technical outages
Negative Reviews: Long wait for elevators up or down (one of the four elevators was out of order on my first evening). leading to many more than 2 to an elevator per hotelâ€™s COVID protocols when one came along. Also, cable TV was out of order across hotel for about 15 hours on 2nd day
Positive Reviews: Great location, super clean, very comfortable and spacious rooms, with well designed kitchenette, flexibility to switch rooms midway (for one with a bathtub), friendly and professional staff

Review Title: Great location in the centre of downtown. Luxurious beddings and very spacious rooms.
Negative Reviews: For a hotel of this type, the entrances were difficult and a bit underwhelming. There's one entrance on King St. (a large street) but there are only push doors so it's difficult to move luggage through. There's another entrance on Melinda St. which is pretty much a small alley on the other side of the building where there's a sliding door entrance and revolving door. The entrances are a bit understated and I wasn't sure if they were the actual hotel entrance.
Positive Reviews: Spacious room with kitchenette. The ceilings were nice and high and the bed was very comfortable. The linens were so soft and luxurious. All the staff was also very courteous and helpful. The location is central in downtown Toronto and right on the subway line so you can access the whole city pretty easily.

Negative Reviews: hotel parking is quite expensive
Positive Reviews: Great location, right in center of downtown. beautiful hotel. Very responsive and friendly staff. Very comfortable beds and spacious room with amenities: Gorgeous view of city dorm hotel:

Negative Reviews: No soap in restaurant washroom downstairs. They should give more soap for handwashing/covid times in the rooms.
Positive Reviews: Nice Staff. Rooms are clean, bed is comfy. Spacious nice views, I always enjoy my stay.

Review Title: Great stay in a great location
Negative Reviews: We were given a free complimentary upgrade upon arrival, Once I saw the room, we declined the upgrade. The layout was terrible and it looked onto a black wall. Not sure what the upgrade was. We were able to get our original room which was great. I was not impressed with the cafe. They are not at all accommodating. The food was good but you buy what they prepare or pay for the things you don't want.
Positive Reviews: Room, location, coffee in the room, bed, free wifi, staff

Negative Reviews: The tv wasn't working properly in my room and it took time to get that sorted - I ended up just going to see a show and have dinner and it was fixed by the time I returned.
Positive Reviews: The hotel itself is beautiful, the location is incredible, and the staff were very friendly! There was an issue with my room, and they were very eager to help and relocate me to a nicer room. The in house bar in the lobby was also nice, friendly staff there too. Location is awesome.

Review Title: Our go-to hotel for weekend trips to Toronto
Negative Reviews: When we stayed in the tower suites we had amazing views. In the historical suite, we overlooked another building. I would also loves robes or the option of asking for one. There were also no towels at the pool and we only had two in our room.
Positive Reviews: This was our third time staying at One King west, but our first time staying in the historical side. Our room was big, we really liked the layout, and were so happy to have a tub. We also enjoyed the hot tub in the fitness centre. This is our go-to hotel in Toronto for the quality, price, and location. The hotel staff is always very friendly and everyone says hello. We are also always appreciative that they will hold onto our bags on the day we check out.

1. Minifridge was suddenly very loud at night which was very disturbing. I asked to fix it in the morning, and there was no problem and they handled it well.

I talked to the front desk and told them I am here in the lobby and if they can let me know when the maintenance are finished. I was in the lobby for almost an hour and nobody came to me, when I came to check what's up they called maintenance and apperantly they didn't even get in because I had a "do not disturb" on my door from earlier. It sounded like they blame me for having this on my door, but I literally came to the lobby and told them I'm here! Felt like they could be a lot more attentive and less small-minded in this matter, and to be mindful about the fact that I'm out of my room in the evening for almost an hour because of a leakage and at least check with the maintenance.
I only stayed for 3 nights, and I had issues in two of them, which is sort of disappointing.

Staff: All staff, from front-desk and concierge, the valet staff, housekeeping & maintenance crew to those working in the cafe provided exceptional customer service.

Check-in was difficult as I only had a debit card physically with me, which seemed to be a problem for the front desk staff - after a long flight from England, travelling with a child and it being late at night. I didn't think the way my daughter and I were treated was acceptable at all, especially as I used a credit card to book the room (online) in the first place, so they had this on file. At one point, it felt like we were going to have to find somewhere else to stay.

Negative Reviews: During COVID, all amenities were closed. They also suspended all in-suite cleaning for the duration of your stay. So if youâ€™re there for a longer stay, you have to do all your own dishes, constantly request new linens and more tea/coffee etc., and take out your own trash. Itâ€™s not much of a relaxing stay. Given that, they should at least reduce the high prices since youâ€™re only getting half the services.
Positive Reviews: Great staff, central location, nice views, big, clean and comfy rooms.

Negative Reviews:
Our room was a bit tired and impersonal. The decor could do with some modernisation and flair to reflect the upscale nature of the rest of the hotel. The bathroom is well-appointed but very small, with a sliding door just off the bedroom area. Robes and slippers were not provided in the room but were available free of charge on request from guest services. 

It would have been nice to be able to order breakfast to the room: room service is only available in the evening/night so you have to go down to the cafe yourself and take away if you want breakfast in your room.

Toronto hotels are expensive, I suppose this hotel is good value for Toronto but it would be a little expensive where we are from (London UK, not a cheap place either!). I would have liked more hanging space and a better area to put our suitcases. It does feel like this hotel is aimed mostly at the single business traveller, for example our room had only one armchair. The elevators also get very busy, especially in the mornings and early evenings: allow enough time to wait for an elevator if you need to be somewhere!
Positive Reviews:
One King West is a large hotel in a beautiful old bank building, ideally located in the financial centre of downtown Toronto. The hotel is 10 minutes walk from Union station and with it's own entrance to the PATH (via the old bank vault, very cool!). You can get straight to King subway or Union station via the PATH. This was an absolute bonus during our stay as the weather was both hot and stormy, so we could stay dry and with AC!

My husband and I stayed for our honeymoon and we were given a suite with a view on the 34th floor of the tower building. We had a lovely view across to the east of Toronto and down to Lake Ontario. The room had a comfortable bed, tv, kitchenette with fridge, tea/coffee making facilities, dishwasher and a small bathroom with good shower & toiletries provided. Housekeeping were very efficient, keeping us re-stocked with towels, toiletries & coffee, running the dishwasher and cleaning the room to a high standard.

We liked Teller's bar (just off the lobby) for happy hour drinks and watching sport on the tv (it was the Euro football tournament during our stay). The morning pastries & coffee from the hotel's Rituals cafe are very nice, as was the brunch we had on our first morning. We also ordered evening room service a couple of times after long days exploring Toronto. We were pleasantly surprised by the high quality of the room service food & drinks, particularly the pasta & red wine was high quality. Room service was prompt and delivery was friendly and courteous.

The gym on the 17th floor is modern & well equipped. It does get a little busy in the mornings as this hotel is popular with business travellers. There are several difference machines, a large weights area, yoga area, male/female saunas and a jacuzzi spa pool. I woke up early with jetlag one morning and had a very pleasant workout with a view over the city.

Negative Reviews: My shower and bathroom sink did not have hot water. I called the front desk that evening and was told maintenance would help. I received one short call from maintenance saying to "just run the water" that's it, which I had already tried before calling down. It was never fixed. When I brought it up at check out, the reception people did not care and brushed it off.
Positive Reviews: I really like the location of this hotel. I was also upgraded upon my arrival to an interior room. Room service and their restaurant is great.

Our room was complete with a coffee machine, a small stove, a microwave, and a few utensils for cooking which was very helpful. We would love to stay here again.

Review Title: A great choice, especially if staying for more than 2 nights
Negative Reviews: We would have loved to rate this hotel higher, however our heating system was broken from day one and we were very cold throughout our entire stay (5 nights) in Toronto. This is not a reflection on the hotel itself, but it definitely put a damper on our stay (February can be extremely cold in this city). For such a highly rated hotel, this should not have been an issue. In all fairness, by day 3 we were offered another room, but we chose not to move at that point since we would have missed on our pre-booked activities.
Positive Reviews: We chose this hotel for its location and for the fact that most rooms come with a kitchen. Ours (located on the 39th floor) did not disappoint: it was very well furnished and equipped with pretty much everything we needed, including a fairly large fridge, dishwasher, and washing machine. Also, 2 TV sets. If you stay more than 2 nights in any city, having all these amenities definitely helps. Needless to say, being so high in the sky, we had an AMAZING view of the city. So amazing, that we decided to save the $90 it would have cost us to go up the CN Tower and skip this activity altogether. Whether sipping on a cup of coffee in the morning, or enjoying a glass of wine in the evening, having the views most rooms come with would make any trip to this beautiful city even more unique.

I appreciate the car jockeys who 
go the extra mile to help out even if it's against policy slightly and everyone seems to have the ability to say yes or no to any request without having to call someone else. My room always has a stylish basic kitchen including a dishwasher, an iron and board, ample storage, large tv with HDMI inputs, plush robes and many more thoughtful touches. It's just a terrific place to stay out of all the hotels that are available in the city to choose from and having tried many, 1KW has been an all round pleasure everytime whether the tower or historic wing. I find it central and convenient. Highly recommended.

Positive Reviews: It was a great location close to everything and Union station. I liked that itâ€™s an apartment hotel so it was good to have the kitchen. Negative Reviews: No pool. Nothing else bad to say!
Positive Reviews:
Great location - less than 10 minute walk to Scotiabank Arena.

Fancy lobby with kind, helpful staff and hotel bar open until 1 am.
Clean, chic room and comfortable bed with nice view from room.

Review Title: I have shared my wonderful experience with others.
Negative Reviews: Can't think of any.
Positive Reviews:
Location is perfect in downtown Toronto. The room was very spacious with kitchenette facilities and amenities. I love the bed. Soft and firm. 

Reception staff was handled well by Amira (?), a Filipina. My daughter and I were most impressed by Monique, and other Concierge staff who too care of our need to leave our bags after checkout before our evening flight.

Negative Reviews: Nothing.
Positive Reviews: Great central hotel. Within walking distance of the train station. Very nice large suite with fabulous views towards the lake (28th floor). Everything you could need including a washer/dryer which was useful to us. Reception staff assisted us with washing power really promptly too. Very clean and tidy everywhere. It's a beautiful building with polished brass rails and looks immaculate. Also loved that the Ritual Cafe was attached to the hotel, which was great for a morning cappuccino with croissant. The cafe staff were excellent, really friendly and quick. Even remembered our order by day 3! The Tellers bar was also very good. We enjoyed eating here, again the servers were attentive and helpful. Great music evening on Thursday.

Negative Reviews: I canâ€™t fault this place.
Positive Reviews:
A classic hotel with mini suites in the tower, which enjoy amazing views, and are actually very good value for central Toronto. Great location right beside a Metro station - and you can access Torontoâ€™s underground PATH system directly from the basement, where you can walk 2.5km of indoor eateries, shops and upscale malls throughout the city.
Rooms are spacious and clean, with quality linens and towels, but what makes this place stand out are the tremendous staff members. Every single person we encountered was unfailingly helpful, friendly and willing to go the extra mile without being asked. A fabulous place. We came for one night, and ended up booking for ten!

Negative Reviews: There wasn't really anything to point out negative.  Toronto is a pricey city to visit.  I can't complain about the high price of hotels, as this was the more affordable hotel downtown.
Positive Reviews: This hotel is on my top 10 hotels list.  I was pleasantly surprised at every turn.  It's in a great location.  The staff were 5 star.  Any help I needed, they were there with a smile.  The rooms were clean and spacious.   They had all the amenities and more.  The room design in the tower was not your contemporary rectangle set up.  It was open and felt more like home, with multiple views of the city.

Review Title: I canâ€™t wait to stay again!
Negative Reviews: Nothing

Only one night but truly amazing!  Very helpful reception desk staff and concierge. Great window view and building's architecture. Well distributed, comfy, clean suite.  ( we were upgraded).
Everyone is so kind,  Canada.â¤ï¸ I was really sad about leaving the place.

Excellent location. Friendly and helpful staff and good service. Room was spacious and well equipped.

Friendly, accommodating and helpful staff. Spent some time at the bar where the bartenders gave us plenty of ideas on how to spend our evening. Very happy with our stay.

Excellent location, really convenient and close to everything we wanted to see and do, all of which were within a 15-20 minute walk (CN Tower, Rogers Stadium, ferry to Toronto Island, etc.). 
Staff were friendly and helpful. 
Room was clean, very comfortable, spacious and included a useful kitchen area.  
Would definitely stay here again.

I stayed in different hotels in Toronto for 2 months, this hotel is very good price/performance ratio.  Would definitely come back.

Review Title: Fantastic night away and I look forward to returning.
Negative Reviews: There was nothing that I disliked.
Positive Reviews: The building itself is extremely unique. The view from the suite was incredible. The room was absolutely spotless. The staff were friendly and helpful.  And the location has to be one of the best in the city.

The room was beautiful and the front of house staff were efficient and polite. The housekeeping staff were lovely as were the ladies running the coffee and snack bar. Thank you. 
Views from my room and hotel location were super. Room was elegant and comfortable. 
I look forward to staying here again.
Spacious suites, very friendly staff, comfy bed. Our room was located on the 41st floor with a nice view on the city and the lake.

Negative Reviews:
Below points are quite nit-picky..  but given the price of the rooms I wanted toc raise them. Generaly, the very nice staff and location still would let me take the hotel again.
- furniture in my room has seen better days, some of it was broken (again, super-helpful staff took care of it right away)
- tools provided for cooking only for most basic cooking. Coffeemaker did not come with the pot, making it useless... this is of course only relevant to those that, like myself, prefer to cook their own breakfast in the morning/ wan to use the kitchen

- The staff was extremely helpful and dealt witz any questions or requests swiftly und satisfactory.

Review Title: Historic Building with Modern Flair and Great Location
Negative Reviews: Their room service could use an upgrade. The food wasn't what I would expect from a 4 star hotel. We ended up ordering through Doordash for the rest of our stay
Positive Reviews: Great location, friendly staff, the building is an old bank office so you can actually walk into the old vault in the basement. Very cool if you are a history buff. We were on the 26th floor so we had a beautiful view down Yonge Street and from the other room, we could see the lake and the skyline with the traffic. The bar makes great martinis and they have Remy Martin XO so we were very happy.

Negative Reviews:
Duvet cover was just two separate sheets. The duvet itself was originally quite dirty. Luckily, room service was able to replace it with a clean one when asked.
Certain handy "evaryday" things were not included, like cleaning cloth, toilet cleaner, etc. (those are relatively cheap and are often included in other apartment hotels).
The coffee had too much rapeseed oil in its composition. A minor first impression:D
Positive Reviews:
Helpful staff.
Functional kitchenette and other appliances (e.g alarm clock with a bluetooth speaker, iron, etc.). Dishwacher turned out to be quite handy.
Good regular cleaning.
Handy outlets.
Powerful central heating.
Decently sized TV. It is possible to connect your laptop to the TV if you have an HDMI cable.
Far-reaching city view (especially if you stay at a higher floor).
Good quality shampoo, shower gel, etc. (nice fragrance)
Cozy, clean, and decently equipped gym, Jacuzzi, and sauna.

Room photos were taken while moving out. The city photo with a green arrow is the ony one that is not mine; it just locates the hotel at the Toronto city skyline.

Review Title: A downtown accessible Hotel near the airport train.
Negative Reviews:
The bin in the room had been forgotten to be emptied which wasn't really a problem.

More coffee available in the room would be a bonus and a few creamers in the plastic sealed bags than just one per cup would be helpful for us coffee drinkers.
Positive Reviews:
It was great value for money.  We missed our flight and needed somewhere to stay whilst we worked out what to do next.  We needed somewhere downtown and accessible to the airport train, UP.  We got an upgrade to a wonderful clean room on the 22nd floor with amazing views of Toronto's immediate skyline with a lovely comfortable bed and easy accessible TV on Booking.com.
There was also a lovely cute bar next to the lobby where the staff was helpful and polite. 
The reception staff were understanding and used to guess when they were coming and going to the airport..

Review Title: Great stay, great location, we'd stay again!
Negative Reviews: The parking lot could not accommodate my vehicle - I have a Ford Ranger and was told it would not fit in the hotel lot.  Another nearby lot was recommended and was accessible via the PATH underground network, so that was convenient and only 3 minutes away from the hotel lobby. The hotel seems to pipe in heavy perfumed scents into the lobby and common areas.  Luckily, I do not have scent sensitivities so it was more of an annoyance rather than a health issue.   The elevators were not reliable - when we checked in, only 1 of the four elevators were working so be prepared to wait in line for 15-20 minutes if that happens again and plan accordingly.  We had to modify our dinner reservations three times because of the wait. Lastly, being a beautiful old building means the plumbing is old, so in the middle of the night, when other rooms use their toilet, the plumbing system can get very loud and wake you up.  Note: we still had a great experience at the hotel and none of these factors would prevent us from booking here in the future, but other travelers might appreciate knowing these details.
Positive Reviews: The location was excellent and everything was within walking distance of the attractions we wanted to see while we were in Toronto. It is conveniently part of the underground PATH network, so in the unpredictable winter weather, we were able to get everywhere and not step foot outside.  It's a beautiful old building with lots of history - it's worth it to take the time and read the stories attached to the images hanging in the corridors. The staff, from the check in personnel, to the cleaning personnel and the restaurant staff, were professional and friendly. I liked the constant communication and updates via text.

Review Title: I really enjoyed my stay - location was excellent and the room very clean & comfortable!
Negative Reviews: No breakfast included and no water bottle(s) provided in the rooms.
Positive Reviews: Very convenient city centre hotel in old Toronto (Financial district). Helpful & professional staff.  Busy, vibrant lobby with open plan reception, bar and restaurant. Spacious room with a comfortable bed with a view and a kitchenette.

Negative Reviews:
The Gym was closed due to covid  and some seating in the lobby restricted.
There was no washing up liquid for the dishes or a cleaning cloth.
The staff were a bit cold in their welcome to guests.
Positive Reviews: This is a great hotel in the financial district near all the high rise buildings with great views. Extremely clean and they even do housekeeping every day.  This was an old bank and it retains some original features such as marble floors , beautiful railings, chandeliers and it's magnificent vault.  An elegant hotel with a cafe in the lobby.

Review Title: Wonderful Hotel, but Not Welcoming Staff
Negative Reviews: Most of my stay was wonderful, totally, I stayed for 12 days at this hotel trying different rooms. In general, the rooms and the facilities are amazing. The only but big thing to ameliorate in my opinion is the customer service. Having worked in the hospitality industry and in hotels, I do understand how important it is to make our guests feel welcomed and cared about. At this property, I did not felt like this unfortunately.
Positive Reviews: I really appreciate the view, the rooms, the facilities and the location. The wonderful One King West Hotel is located in the financial district which is very convenient.

Negative Reviews: Staff not welcoming..Lobby dark unimpressive,  room decor was ok but not worth the money they are charging per night.  Bathroom is a disappointment ðŸ˜ž
Positive Reviews: Views were good..barely could see the water.  ..Bed was comfortable.

Negative Reviews: The shower was not user-friendly to use, switching the shower on and off isn't practical - and adjusting the intensity/pressure of the shower wasn't possible. The kitchen was lacking essentials such as dish-washing equipment - no sponge, no dishwashing tablets or dishwashing soap, which was a problem because some of the dishes and cutlery wasn't clean and needed to be washed again. I was unfortunate with the layout of my room as it had almost no natural light, which meant room lights had to always be on. Also - I would have appreciated a late checkout of 12pm without having to pay - especially as my flight was delayed.
Positive Reviews: The location of the hotel is perfect for someone who wants to be close to the centre and downtown. Situated in a busy street, however, the noise cancellation was good. Was handy having a kitchen despite it missing some essentials. I appreciated how spacious the room was as well, especially as I was staying with my dog. The bed is the best part of the room. Kudos to the concierge Mathew for his warm hospitality and kindness.

Review Title: good location, clean , below average service
Negative Reviews:
the only thing that lets this hotel down is its staff overall attention to details and service 

we were only there for two nights i have come from Australia. it was raining we asked for courtesy umbrellas. 

Faisal the gentlemen at the concierge only gave us one and said he had no more left but we can see there were several more in the room. 

this is really bad way to treat your guest. we basically had to argue for the second only because I saw that he had spares. 

there are no slippers in the rooms and overall staff service though not bad was not so great. I travel a lot and know when I get good service. 

very minor improvements in service can really change the gussets experience
Positive Reviews: good location, clean hotel and good facilities

Review Title: Great location for a short stay

Spa area was nice but not in a very picturesque location in the building so felt a little awkward.
Positive Reviews: Very comfy bed, great location downtown, great views, friendly staff

Review Title: Great customer service, rooms, and location!
Negative Reviews: Price for 1 night was a little too high, especially considering it was an interior view room. There also wasnâ€™t any shampoo in the bathroom and the sliding bathroom door didnâ€™t offer much privacy. The bathroom door lock was also broken.
Positive Reviews: Location and staff were great! AC in the room was really good too. Bed was super comfy and everything was clean.

Negative Reviews:
Both times we have had quite a small  room with the lake view. O have to admit that for the second stay I was hoping to get another room to have a comparison.
I also wished that there was some bottled water waiting for the guests. Outside of that, I recommend to stay at One West King hotel!
Positive Reviews:
It was a great stay!
We came to Toronto for a week. We stayed two nights at One King West, went for one night to Niagara Falls and got back to One King for another three nights.
The location is absolutely great. A few minutes walk from the station and right in the middle of the financial district.
The rooms are cosy and stuff is very friendly.

Review Title: it was an enjoyable and great experience. I will stay here again.

Positive Reviews: great location and access to public transportation, the airport train is a 10 minute walk away, very clean with excellent housekeeping service, superb customer support, great WIFI,easy check in

Review Title: Good hotel in a good position but bathroom needs updating and some improvement to housekeeping.     and

Positive Reviews:
Very good location with a Metro station just outside and also linked by the PATH network. Also easy walking distance to many restaurants and cafes and the shore of Lake Ontario with its ferry terminal and water taxis to the Toronto Islands.
The hotel used to be a bank and has interesting features such as the bank safe room and the public rooms are very grand. The building itself is beautiful.

Review Title: Very comfortable stay. I loved the view and the bar service. The staff was amazing.
Negative Reviews: parking was not included or at least that is what I understood. That was first come first served and it was full at the time I asked.
Positive Reviews: The bar and restaurant service. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The view from the room was espectacular (floor 44). The food and the specials were amazing.

Review Title: A incredible view from Toronto in a very nice hotel
Negative Reviews: The parking price is very high
Positive Reviews: We loved the spacious room and the incredible view. Negative Reviews: The wait time for lifts/elevators getting up and down the property
Positive Reviews:
The room was lovely and spacious, with an excellent kitchen area and washer/dryer facilities.

The hotel is in a great location, next to the King subway station and a streetcar stop. It connects directly to the underground PATH network so you can walk from key landmarks without going outside, should you need.

There is a cafe connected to the hotel which serves excellent food for breakfast and lunch. The kitchen food at dinner time is very good and I was impressed by the quality of room service when I used it.

I ended up staying in Toronto for an additional week beyond my original booking and was very happy to continue my stay at the hotel.

Negative Reviews: we booked the suite deluxe and a table and chairs would have been useful to eat (there was two armchair and little table. you can wait around 5 min to get in the elevator (one in four was out of order) the building in more than 46 floors but only 4 elevators.
Positive Reviews: The location is great. bed very comfy. staff was very helpfull. restaurant and bar where you can garb something to eat.

Negative Reviews: No inroom dining, but still restaurant and cafe in the lobby, you dont need to leave the building!
Positive Reviews: Spacious and comfy room, full kitchen, great bath, shower and bathtub. Incredible view, river and CN tower!

Review Title: great comfortable place in good location

Negative Reviews: Unfortunately after having breakfast at the Ritual cafe my husband got very bad food poisoning. Please check in with this food service in terms of cleanliness, etc. we would hate for this to happen to another guest.
Positive Reviews: The hotel was beautiful, we loved our room and it was a great location. Staff was very friendly and accommodating, we have no complaints about the hotel.

Positive Reviews: Location, staff friendliness, check-in and check-out experience, cleanliness, noise level

Review Title: Always a favourite place to stay.
Negative Reviews: I wish there was breakfast room service.
Positive Reviews: Location is perfect. Love the staff and our beautiful room.

Negative Reviews:
Room not ready as promised on three separate attempts to check-in Finally got in the room at 7:30 in the evening after wandering the streets for 6 hours.  It was overheated at 25 degrees. Made for a poor start to the trip. Paid for a full-day and got less than half apart from sleep.
 Received a $20 coupon for the restaurant - too late to use and restaurant did not open until well after checkout so not a great solution.
Staff were uniformly friendly and understanding but at the end of the day.......! We have stayed here probably 20+ nights and this was our first really disappointing stay so hopefully a one off event

Positive Reviews: position and views of the city, bed was really comfortable.

Positive Reviews: Location is great and value is also great for being right downtown. View from the room is also great, and the bed was quite comfy.

Review Title: Historic One Suite with a king sized bed and a sofa bed
Negative Reviews: Sometimes cleaning service doesn't give you all the toiletries you need like body wash and mouthwash. If you use the kitchen utensils and cups, they will take it away and not return it so we didn't have any to use in the remaining days of our trip.
Positive Reviews: My family and I felt very comfortable staying at this hotel/residence. It felt like staying in a clean modern apartment. The location is great too. You can take the subway underneath using King Station to get around town.

Negative Reviews: Self-parking is difficult. The A/C unit in the room didn't work properly. The hotel was not helpful in providing information about COVID testing for international travelers.
Positive Reviews: Good location. The rooms are decent-sized.

Review Title: Overall poor service from staff excellent location

Positive Reviews:
the location was great
it was nice to have a kitchen

Negative Reviews: Due to COVID, there were limited services but the room had a kitchen which made up for things. I think the kitchen could have used some cleaning supplies, though.
Positive Reviews: Location was perfect for a week of work meetings. It was quiet despite being on Yonge Street. Very comfortable bed and I think I used the tub every day.

The kitchen units were looking very worn and there were no thoughtful extras other than the very old school coffee maker. One of our bedside lights didn't work. 

The room generally felt like it needed a refresh.

He was able to get it to heat but it still didn't dry the clothes (we didn't have the time to request another service).  In all fairness to the hotel, they tried to help.  The kitchen didn't have a few supplies we would have liked (like a tea towel, dishwashing detergent, etc).  Small things really.  Great hotel.
Positive Reviews: The beds and pillows were very comfortable and the staff were pleasant and accommodating.  The location was perfect for access to the waterfront train station and several local sights.  The hotel was modern and beautiful.

Despite having such a large room, it was very clean and the housekeeping staff did a tremendous job during my stay. I also liked that the room was not too noisy, even with the hotel being right on the corner of Yonge and King in the heart of Downtown Toronto. The location is perfect and easy to get around the city by TTC (the streetcar and subway stop right by the hotel, and Union Station is only a short distance away), or by foot (the PATH is also adjacent to the hotel). Teller's Bar and Bistro and the adjacent Daily Ritual Cafe serve great food, and the staff was always friendly and helpful.

Negative Reviews: The only thing I didn't like was seeing the red indicator below this box that I am writing in slowly change to green as I type....there was nothing that we could fault with our stay at One King Street Hotel and Residence.Â  I am sure that many other people go and stay at places with the sole purpose to find fault...if only they bothered to engage with the people who run and work in hospitality not treat them and what they do with disdain and a negative outlook.Â  It's green now, so I'll stop!
Positive Reviews: Great location with access to all the sights and sites!  The team at the hotel were really helpful from the moment we walked through the door.  Checking in was easy and the room was brilliant.  Plenty of space for us and all of our stuff - room to spread and room to move!  The room had everything you would need for a long stay - not something that you get in the UK!  We spent many a happy hour in the bar/lounge area - super service from the team.  Great drinks and cocktails served with a smile and a conversation.  We ate on our second day and the hotel food was probably the best we had in Toronto and great value for money.  On checkout we left our bags (we were flying 12 hours afetr checkout!) and the concierge team were really helpful.  We would, without hesitation, book this hotel again when we revisit Toronto.

Review Title: It was one night but perfect choice
Negative Reviews: No thing to be mentioned
Positive Reviews:
Room:
The room I stayed in was a little small, but it was certainly acceptable. The space was well-designed and utilized efficiently. While it might not be the most spacious room, I found it to be cozy and well-appointed, ensuring a comfortable stay.

Location:
The location of the hotel was exceptional, especially for those looking to experience the vibrant heart of downtown. Situated in an active area, the hotel is conveniently close to prominent attractions such as the CN Tower and other points of interest. Notably, Yonge-Dundas Square is within easy reach, adding to the convenience of exploring the city's offerings.

What I appreciated most was the hotel's access to the lower level of the city, providing direct access to a variety of restaurants and essential services. Additionally, the convenience of reaching the parking garage in the nearby building without having to step outside was a significant plus. The property itself offers parking options, and I found the 15% discount for parking in the adjacent building to be a great perk, enhancing the overall convenience factor.

Bed:
The bed in the room was a king-size bed, and I must say it was quite comfortable. After a day of exploring the city, it was a delight to return to a spacious and comfortable bed, ensuring a restful night's sleep.

Overall, I highly recommend this hotel. Despite the room being a bit on the smaller side, its prime location, accessibility to key attractions, and thoughtful amenities like the comfortable king-size bed and convenient parking options make it an excellent choice for a memorable stay in the city.

Negative Reviews: Nothing

A great stay in Toronto.

My only con is the parking. If you don't get there early, there will be no parking available. This was an inconvenience when you might have a few items to carry. There is a parking garage by Wellington Street, about a 5-minute walk, that is considerably cheaper for overnights but inconvenient.  So be prepared to find alternative parking if you won't be checking in early. 

On another note, if there is an event taking place, chances are no parking will be available. Hoping something can be done to accommodate guests.

Negative Reviews: When we first arrived we were given a room on the 15th floor. All we could see was a blue wall from another building. I can see how this room could work for business people who are only there to sleep. We called down to the front desk and they were amazing with no questions asked, they moved us to a new room. They staff were super friendly and happy to accommodate us.
Positive Reviews: Once we got switched to our new room we absolutely loved it! And couldn't have been more happier. The view was fantastic (our room was on the 27th floor)- we could see the lake & CN tower ! The room was super spacious with a living room, kitchenette,  bathroom and bedroom. The lobby was absolutely beautiful! We will definitely rent here again!

Negative Reviews: I never thought this beautiful hotel could have rooms with such a bad view and the elevator took years! Worst elevator experience of my life!
Positive Reviews: I booked the wrong room. The first time I made a reservation here, I had a beautiful view and the room was nice, but the second time, it was a really bad choice! Do not pick "interior room" unless you just need a very dark room to sleep all day long and no light(natural or artificial) at all. It was really bad and I just wanted to leave as soon as possible. No business centre. No pool. The elevator takes years! I had to wait more than 7 minutes every time! The house keeping lady did not leave any toilet paper or tissues, neither coffee so I had to call and ask for it. The kitchen had no pots, so I asked for one since I needed it to cook food for my pet. I ordered a vegerarian pizza and did not like it so much but the size is good. The location was great and the lobby is beatiful. However, I would never go back to the same room. So, in case I considered to choose this hotel again, I would make sure I am getting a room with a nice view but honestly, it was such a bad experience (the last room) that I don't think I would like to go there again...bad memories.

Negative Reviews:
There are many streets that are closed for construction or do not allow turns off of Yonge St. We couldnâ€™t figure out where the entrance was to the Hotel to temporarily park, register and bring in our luggage. We ended up parking in Brookfield Place * and walking the P.A.T.H. with our luggage where we discovered that entrance to the hotel is on Melinda St which is open for about 200m before closure. You can turn left off of Yonge St as you are approaching it. 
* The garage was safe, clean and even without the hotel discount reasonably priced. We left the car there the entire time and walked or took the very convenient subway everywhere!
Positive Reviews: This is a beautiful hotel with a gorgeous, roomy lobby area in a convenient location. Our room on the 20th floor was fabulous. - Clean, bright and neat with a well appointed kitchen area . We also enjoyed breakfast at the Daily Ritual Cafe and other nearby restaurants.

After a day of walking around downtown through the damp fog we were looking forward to using the hot tub but it was closed for renovations, which wasn't mentioned when we booked. 

It would have been nice to have a few liquid creamers to go with the coffee/tea instead of the powdered kind, and there wasn't enough sugar or powdered creamer to go with the amount of coffee pods/tea bags provided. 

Hotel parking was expensive and only available using a valet service, but we found off-site secure underground parking only a block away that we could reserve through an app for less than half the price of the on-site parking.
Positive Reviews:
The bed, bedding and pillows were very comfortable. So comfortable in fact I called the hotel after I got home to ask how to buy a pillow like the ones they used (unfortunately they said they were only buyable by hotels). 

Communicating with guest services to make requests or check out by text was very convenient. 

The layout of our initial room was a bit claustrophobic but we were moved to a room with a different layout in the same room category quickly and without fuss. 

The person who brought us room service was exceptionally warm and friendly. 

Value was good for the location.

Positive Reviews: Incredible value for a clean, stylish hotel in an ideal location. I was blown away by the room, which was spacious and had sweeping skyline views. Beautiful kitchen and bathroom (with a view from the tub). Spend the extra few dollars for a tower suite with a view.

The central location to public transit, the airport train, the baseball field, the concert / ice-hockey arena meant the location was perfect. The bar seemed very vibey.
Large, comfortable and clean room, amazing city view, location is very convenient. Spa was really good.

Negative Reviews: Nothing
Positive Reviews: The location, you can enter the hotel from subway directly. And it's super close to the train station. The kitchen in the room is super convenient. The elevator in the old building is good for photos!

Location - situated at the very heart of Toronto.
Room - very clean, nicely furnished and decorated rooms.

The location is perfect, we rented three rooms and they were clean, and the kitchenette  worked for us. Other than that I would definitely stay here again.
Conveniently near Union station and able to get many places in the city conveniently! The room was spacious and the bed was very comfy.

The hotel had a vibey bar area and, having previously housed a bank, had a fascinating bank vault in the basement.

Review Title: Amazingly clean, spacious room but absence of room service.

I would have expected a better bathroom/tub for the cost of the Premium Tower Suite. It seems like the rooms are all different layouts, so I was hoping for a room with a detached tub but didn't happen to get one.

Negative Reviews: Unfortunately, after 26 hours of travelling from Europe to Toronto arriving at 00:15 am, I found that there was an over booking (I had booked over 6 months prior) for 5 nights + another night after spending 2 nights at Niagara Falls in between. We had to walk some 300m (BTW we were very exhausted with 4 luggages assisted by a front desk personnel) to a same category hotel and had to check in again the day after. Obviously, this was very disappointing not just because we where exhausted but we spoilt our first morning at Toronto to settle down. The next day at least they sent us an Uber, under my insistence and we were greeted by the hotel manager where she was very polite and apologetic. As a compensation, they waived our first night, gave us an upgrade valid also even when we returned for the single night, gave us CAD 20 daily vouchers for breakfast (enough for a pastry and a coffee each) and an additional CAD 40 to use in any restaurant at the hotel. Obviously all this eased our anger and disappointment. If it was not for this over booking I would have given a much higher rating of this hotel. Final note. We would have appreciated if they had contacted use prior to our check in regarding the over booking as we would have went straight to the other hotel and at least they could have provided us with a taxi instead of walking to the other hotel.
Positive Reviews: Location is very central and ideal with a good network of public transport. The building in itself is unique being a bank and converted into hotel/residences. Staff were very helpful. Food purchased from hotel was very good and the hotel is very clean.

Their voices were loud, it sounded that they were receiving cleaning instructions from the hotel reception and I could hear the microphone transmitting the order. This lasted for about an hour. Review Title: Overall, I was happy with the hotel.
Negative Reviews:
The building seemed a bit old. 

I arrived earlier than expected to check in, but there was no rom available. That's understandable, and there was a service to take care of my luggage. However, there was not a place to change my cloths in the morning, as I needed to change before going to the conference in the same day. I was instructed by the staff to change in the toilet of the hotel, which was not pleasant. It'd be good if a change room is added to the hotel for such situations.
Positive Reviews: The staff were friendly, the location was really good.

Review Title: Great base for our first time to Toronto!
Negative Reviews: Room and bathroom were a little bit dated, and kitchenette needed some fixing up. Lobby was always crowded/noisy as it is incorporated with the bar and restaurant but staff were all very helpful!
Positive Reviews: Great location - very central to be able to walk to different parts of the city! Room was a great size and kitchenette was handy for a longer stay. The hotel cafe downstairs does great takeaway food and coffee! Would definitely recommend this hotel for travellers!

Negative Reviews: The toilet paper was the worst (rough, thin and non-absorbent). Sounds petty perhaps but when you are paying close to $300/night you expect a little more. The other niggly things were not all food items listed on the room service/bar menu that is given to you at check in are available for room service but there is no information to indicate this until you call down and are advised accordingly. A simple line on the menu or asterisk next to items for bar service only would be a simple fix. Our room was supposed to be in the historic part of the hotel and I am sceptical it was as looking out the windows and from the ground it was all or at least in part in the modern addition and the room was opposite a large conference/event room that was offering some kind of breakfast buffet each morning with an early set up that woke us up two of the three mornings due to carts of tableware being wheeled past our door and set up.  We had lightbulbs that were burnt out and not working and the position of the tap in the bathroom sink was the wrong size and was positioned too far back making the end of the tap virtually touching the back of the sink making it nigh on impossible to wash your hands easily. Simple functional  elements that should have been corrected during the conversion but werenâ€™t.  For the location the hotel is ideal. Value for the money is not there and I donâ€™t think I would stay again as little things add up to bigger things and there are cheaper hotels in the area which are just as comfortable with similar amenities and with better t.p.
Positive Reviews: The location is perfect and less than a ten minute walk from Union Station. A lovely converted bank with many original features. Common areas and rooms were clean and well thought out. The hotel is in a perfect spot for shopping, sightseeing and events. Staff were very friendly and the attached coffee shop has excellent coffee and breakfast/lunch items in lieu of hotel offered services.

Negative Reviews:
The room was dirty.

Stains on the wall (both like liquid stains and brown sticky unidentified substance stains), stains on the curtains, dirty hair everywhere, dust everywhereâ€¦ to the point it was rolling on the floorâ€¦ food and other unidentified crumbles in basically every corner. I even found an open and rusty basting pin on the floor. The floor itself was scratched badly (like someone played with a big knife on it). Overall scratches and paint chips all over the furniture. The shower head did not work properly and dont expect to get any hygiene products cause you get one tiny bar of soap and thatâ€™s it.

At least the bed appeared to be clean.

Every time you want to take the elevator, be ready to wait 10 minutes.

There is no trolley for luggage nor help to bring them to your room so dont bring too much.

If you want ice you have to go for a 10 minute trip and go down about 18 foors (you might even have to switch elevator).

The overall condition of the hotel is just not consistent with a 4 star hotel whatsoever. 

Needs a serious revamping.

Positive Reviews: Great location that connects to the underground. Nice lobby bar. Interesting & different hotel because it used to be a bank. My room had a great view as well. Lots of positives

Review Title: Always check-out at the front desk even if they say you don't have to.
Negative Reviews: They text you when you arrive in your room to let you know you can use the service. They then text you about breakfast and checkout, which they say can be contactless - simply text them when you're ready to leave and drop your key. I did both, and as I was getting on the subway got a text that I had done it wrong and had to checkout at the front desk. I was already out of the hotel. So now they're holding my security deposit and won't tell me why without being in-person, in the middle of a pandemic. Not a great look to follow instructions they gave, and then be punished for it.
Positive Reviews: The location is amazing for this hotel. You can get around the city very easily with the subway linked right underneath. There's also amazing bars and restaurants around OKW. Bed was comfy and AC good.

Review Title: Good location, and views but overpriced food services
Negative Reviews: Communication between staff and guests could be improved! I had an event to go to but wanted to go and use the sauna before, however I forgot my slippers! When I had called reception to request some the concierge said he would send house keeping up.  About 20 mins later I called again to check on the status he said in about 10 mins someone would be there, so I waited... nothing. Called back about 20 mins later again and a woman answered and when I asked the status of the slippers she said they had none. It was frustrating as I did not feel like the communication between staff and guests was very good, nor was my time respected. I ordered room service and it was not great. I ordered a burger and cheesecake, there was some mango puree that tasted expired, and the most random chocolate sauce poured around it. Definitely not worth the price, that was also way later than they told me.
Positive Reviews: The room itself was nice, and the hotel was able to accommodate my requests of having a view of the city, and water and be on a high floor. Location was great!

Review Title: very pleasant, have stayed many times

Positive Reviews: Our room was on the 47th floor and the views were amazing!

Negative Reviews: Room service came in while we were sleeping in the afternoon (around 4-5) to clean our bathroom. We were a bit surprised when we woke up. Having our room cleaned more would've been better. Also, there wasn't much communication in the information I got for the room about how to contact room service, etc, so more information wouldn't be great to have ahead of time.

Review Title: Guest services is exceptional but hotel (especially housekeeping) has degraded seriously since pre- COVID-19
Negative Reviews:
However, I booked my stay through booking.com and was supposed to receive a $530 refund due to the issues we encountered, I even have a letter from the Hotel indicating that the hotel has processed everything with booking.com and booking.com should be refunding me. It has been since August 28th and booking.com is not responding to phone calls nor emails so Iâ€™m left defrauded of $530. 

Issues included: (1) since no housekeeping during stay, towels were supposed to be provided for the duration of the stay, we received towels for one person for one day for a two person four night stay. Requested more and had a bag of towels and toiletries dropped at the room door including (2) a bunch of wet dirty cleaning rags blended in with the clean towels. (3) duvets in two of the three rooms we were in were probably 15 years old and had absolutely no stuffing. (4) the second room we got had non-functioning air conditioning; or actually it was a suite where only the main living space was air conditioned but the bedroom area couldnâ€™t get below 26 degrees at all. (5) the second roomâ€™s shower stall was full of black curly hairs on the walls, indicating zero effort being made to clean it. 

Overall, guest services was absolutely wonderful and corrected all of the housekeeping deficiencies (hopefully long-term and not just for my own stay), but unfortunately until booking.com refunds me my $530, I am forced to leave negative reviews for both booking.com and One King West. If I ever see my refund, I will adjust One King Westâ€™s review to account for the efforts the hotel made to remedy issues. In the meantime, Iâ€™m just feeling defrauded.
Positive Reviews: So to start, I wasnâ€™t going to leave a negative review from a negative experience because Guest Services and management truly went out of their way to correct for concerning housekeeping issues and bellhops trying to squeeze more than the allowed number of people in each elevator on a regular basis (yes, guests had to enforce the two people per elevator policy bc the hotel employees encouraged people to cram in like sardines when it was busy).

Review Title: Mediocre at best: in need of new management and a thorough makeover.
Negative Reviews: My room was dingy and in need of refurbishment -- it is very strange in room that can obviously accommodate a couple to have only one comfortable chair. There should be two chairs or two seat sofa in king bedrooms. The hotel staff, particularly the manager I spoke to, was condescending when I expressed my concerns about the hotel staff not wearing masks. A mask recommendation had just been issued n Toronto -- recommended, not required indoor masking. She and her staff decided to largely ignore the situation with the new Omicron variant, which put me at risk and made me extremely uncomfortable while I was staying there. I met with the manager to explain my concerns and she adopted a negative and rude tone of voice with me and dismissed my concerns. I also received poor advice about local dining -- on my arrival around 10pm, I was sent somewhere that was closed for maintenance but the hotel concierge had assured me it was open, even though the Open Table website said there were no tables available. When I returned from my futile trip to the restaurant she apologized but then I had to order room service which cost an astounding $38 for a club sandwich consisting of hunks of greasy meat and a beer (the room service charge of $5 was waived). I found the staff at the front desk to be generally grumpy and perfunctory. (I noted here as elsewhere that aspects of the public spaces are filthy -- the globe lamps hanging over the front desk area are covered in dust). I do think the price for the hotel is quite competitive, but it could not be any higher because of the dingy quality of the interior, the poor service and the insufficient number of elevators for a building of this size. The view from my room was extraordinary and made up for some of the other faults.
Positive Reviews: I liked the view from my room.

Review Title: Downgraded at my checkin without any reason, the beginning of the end!
Negative Reviews:
The comminication mainly. Hard to understand the staff because of the noise (we had the impression to arrive in a night club at 10pm for our checkin). Plus, they announced us we are downgraded. They hardly know the concept of empathy, more the concept of business. I saw some clients negociate some stuffs like we were in market or in a developped country. So, they show sometimes no empathy to us, international customers. I speak mainly dor the communivation, they could make an efdort and articulate a bit more. Also and mostly, I didn't like to be downgraded... without any explanation. Waiting for a 30% off on the night downgraded but still nothing after 5 days. Not them to manage, will be booking business of course..

Nobody show us around aftet the checkin or explain how works the hotel, the services, the room service, the entrance. I had to ask them and ask some amenities all the time, like soap or basic things for the suite. It is not a classic hotel, it's an hotel and residence to be accurate. They could explain better their concept and their system.
The restaurant of the hotel ask you to tips when the tips are already included, called "gratuity". They know that we are not from Canada: A french and a bresilian. They could explained instead of say nothing. I paid $125 for two steacks frites with 30 min late and not with the right cooking for the steaks. They clearly abuse of the tourists when they can..

I tried to express my unsatisfaction to the lobby at multiple times, they make me feel terrible about it so I prefer to stop saying anything.
Also, I have to say, I was impatient to come back home because my bed and my pillow are way better.. I had to ask a duvet and some pillow because the ones we had were crashed, like nothing inside. It's a lot for a first night after being downgraded without any explanation..
Positive Reviews: I like the location even if they didn't tell us they have a direct access to the courtroom/underground gallery who lead to the subway. It's not like we were from Toronto, they could just tell us, mostly in winter..

Review Title: Nice views but not family friendly or worth the money. Other more friendly and stylish hotels in TO.
Negative Reviews: The staff were rude, especially so in relation to us travelling with our two children. My kids (age 10 and 12) were behaving just fine when we checked-in but the staff member went out of her way to repeat several times that we would be kicked out of the hotel if there were two noise complaints (I've never had a hotel threaten me like this at check-in!) and that my kids could not walk around the hotel by themselves. I listened in to people checking in without kids and did not hear any of this. We had booked a suite with two queen beds but when we opened the room it smelled so strongly of dog/dog food we requested a different room. The only suite left had a small and terribly uncomfortable hide-a-bed that barely fit my two kids. I wouldn't stay here again -- totally not worth it. Instead, check-out the super quaint Broadview Hotel in the Riverside neighbourhood. That hotel is truly classy and staff were very friendly -- especially to my kids!
Positive Reviews: The location was central and transit/walking where easy. The view from our 41st floor room was great. The kitchen was good.

Review Title: I would definitely stay here again

Negative Reviews: The room was average at best.  I was expecting much more for the price we paid.  Acceptable, but it was like a good budget hotel back home.
Positive Reviews: Location, location, location.  Heart of downtown within walking distance to many restaurants, bars, attractions,.  Subway and cable car right outside the door.  Access to underground Toronto inside the lobby.  Staff was very helpful.  Though we never used the hotel bar, restaurant or coffee shop, they looked very nice and we're always crowded so I assume they were good.

the noise we thought the whole night people were with us in the suite â€¦ we had women celebrating a birthday the whole night, then they fought and security manager came, some were intoxicated and police was called. Review Title: Impressive accommodation with some annoying defects
Negative Reviews: The microwave in our room turned on but did not heat anything.  The toilet ran (water leakage from the tank into the bowl) creating an annoying noise of flowing water.  I had to reach into the tank several times to fix the problem.  One of the cupboard doors was askew on its hinges.  There were no instructions or soap for either the dishwasher or the in-suite laundry machine, nor was there a dish towel.  Pretty simple problems to solve, which leads one to believe that the hotel management either doesnâ€™t know how to operate a 4-star establishment, or simply doesnâ€™t care.
Positive Reviews: Great central location in downtown Toronto close to Union Station, Bay Street, and a subway station on the Yonge Street line (Yonge-University Line).  The Tellerâ€™s Bar off the lobby of the hotel provides a good dining option for travel-weary guests.

Negative Reviews: There wasn't enough lighting in the living / kitchenette area. I think another table light next to the sofa would be better.

It's conveniently located outside of the subway station and close to streetcar stops. The staff is friendly and helpful - really like the ability to text the concierge. Also, the building is absolutely stunning. 

The suite was spacious and had great views. The kitchenette came equipped with things needed.

Review Title: great views great bed great loco no brekkie

Absolutely amazing.

East to find a 12 minute walk just up the street from Union Station.
Zero complains about this room and hotel.

I donâ€™t advise to use the sofa bed for sleeping because itâ€™s so terrible. the worst thing in this hotel is that your room door will be knocked each morning between 8:30-10:30 without requesting a room service to clean up your room and they will keep knocking your door until you open. This is so annoying considering that there is a big chance that people are sleeping so by waking them up you are interrupting their time of rest and privacy.
