Ivan deserving special mention for delivering my masks to my room in omicron days so I wouldn't have to go down to the lobby without one and for delivering good-natured assistalnce with personality plus.These staff members and the thoughtful Krishna and Ana are all at the heart of what makes 1KW special and keeps guests coming back.

Review Title: Nice Hotel in the heart of Toronto with great views of the city.
Negative Reviews: The service is a cross between a longer-term rental and a nice hotel.  The towels should be improved.  I would expect to see a more plush bigger towel set for the style of the hotel but they were plentiful and changed daily.  Parking was not available which was inconvenient but there was plenty of parking close to the hotel and we left the car all weekend in favour of walking and Uber rides so it was not a big deal.  The restaurant is in the lobby and would be considered more of a bar.  It was not appealing to us but I am sure it appeals to 20-35-year-olds.
Positive Reviews: The room was originally on the 20th floor with a below-average view.  I asked for a higher floor with a better view and they placed us on the 31st floor with a view of the lake.  It was exceptional on a higher floor.  The rooms are clean and modern. The text service for room requests was simple and the response was immediate. The location of the hotel is great.  It is close to many great restaurants.  It is also right beside King station for those that like public transit.  Room service was typical in pricing and service.  The food was good.  All in all a great experience.

Review Title: very peaceful and relaxing to spend the night away from home.
Negative Reviews: i didnâ€™t like that there wasnâ€™t any paper towel or kleenex in the kitchen area. we had to use the bathroom towels to wipe our mess.
Positive Reviews: very clean, quite, sent messages about all opportunities we had such as room service and the dinner and breakfast menus. also loved that we had access to the hot tub and gym late nights.

Negative Reviews: Not dislikes but suggestions for slight improvements: please put more than one T bag per night in the room for your English travellers and some mini milk cartons as tea or coffee with creamer just doesn't work. Also, it is unusual to find a hotel with aircon that doesn't provide a small bottle of water. The rooms are a little dark even with all the lights on. Perhaps one additional main bright light would help. I think you should signpost your kitchenette facilities better on the booking.com website as if I'd known it was available in advance, I would have packed fewer clothes and washed clean when here.  These are all very minor and did not detract from a great stay.
Positive Reviews: I really liked this hotel. The hotel has great character. Rather than just being a boring building, it has some history, which gives it a good feel. It makes you feel more relaxed and at home than "staying away." The staff are super friendly and efficient. The bar is lively and offers good bar food and a selection of cocktails. The valet parking is helpful, although there are limited spaces, so you are not guaranteed a spot. I stayed 4 nights and got a spot 3 out of 4 times, but there is local parking a couple of minutes walk away. The room had a very comfortable bed and was quiet with a good shower. The built-in kitchenette is an excellent idea with a dishwasher, washing machine, fridge, hob, and microwave tastefully installed.  I loved The Daily Ritual Coffee Shop built into the hotel. Being open to the public means you get a standard of service and speed, which you would expect from a Starbucks but with better coffee and food.

Review Title: Fantastic location and views with wonderful staff.
Negative Reviews: It was frustrating that in a hotel geared up for long stays - our suite had a washer/dryer, fridge,cooker and microwave - there was only one easy chair in the room. One of us always had to sit on the bed since there was only one chair.

Negative Reviews: No convenience stores within close walking proximity.
Positive Reviews:
The hotel is in a great location and you can access the PATH system underneath which was great as 
we experienced crappy weather. Rooms were also very spacious and exceeded my expectations. Highly recommended and we'll definitely be back!

Negative Reviews: The bathroom was awkward. The door was large and opened into the room. With the door open, you couldnâ€™t easily stand at the sink. With it closed, it felt somewhat claustrophobic. This would have been the perfect opportunity for a door that slides across the opening. Also, we didnâ€™t like that we couldnâ€™t order breakfast room service. This may just be a cultural difference but there was no room service and service in the lobby was confusing. Customers had to go next door to place their orders and then the food was delivered to their tables but it wasnâ€™t as nice as actual waitress service.
Positive Reviews: We had what I imagine was a smaller Tower suite on the 22nd Floor. Having windows on three sides of the room was wonderful. The kitchen facilities were great and the washer and dryer were completely unexpected and GREAT! The staff was terrific!!

The elevators took too long with volume of residents, staff and guests using the elevators.   Coffee maker in room was missing parts and did not have clear instructions.  Too much spam email/text about onsite restaurant and coffee shop (too early in morning waking me up)
Positive Reviews: Generally the room and space was fine.  Concierge staff was very nice and courteous.

Negative Reviews: Lighting in room could have been better.

Negative Reviews:
The bed was a bit too soft, but not a big deal. It was a good stay.

Positive Reviews: It was a great stay overall. Sparkling clean, friendly staff, well located.

Negative Reviews: Bathroom door. Opens into the bathroom leaving no room to use the sink/mirror so you really need to shut the door.  Would be better with a sliding door.

Negative Reviews: the lack of daytime room service, breakfast specifically.

Saying all these, for the price and location I'll would have stayed again but no I wouldn't because the bed was too soft and quite uncomfortable for more than 2 nights stay.

In general: a very centrally located hotel with modern amenities. Also the best information policy we've had in a long time: we got daily messages from the hotel both on standard topics (availability of breakfast or lunch at the hotels facilities, check out information etc) but also on important events in the city (e.g. a festival that could affect car access to the hotel - this was sentboth electronically and in paper so that we would really get the update).

Positive Reviews: Nice clean and friendly

Review Title: Good location but would likely won't return.
Negative Reviews:
- We told the hotel that we were staying for our 15th anniversary, ended up in a room at the end of a hall near housekeeping.. it was Very loud early in the morning (8-9am). Wasn't able to sleep in at all due to housekeeping staff being extremely loud.. it sounded like they were just constantly yelling back and forth in the halls
- TV was a bit small for the room
- One cocktail at the lobby bar is 20$....... 
- We ordered room service at about midnight... Very uncomfortable situation, wouldn't recommend!! The delivery man came right into our room and was very loud. My husband answered the door and the guy just came right on in and was talking to me while I was sitting on our bed.. so awkward.. like just deliver our order at the door and allow for some privacy. It was a very uncomfortable situation.. I also have no idea what the guy was even saying because his English was so poor. 
- There was a very dirty, wet, stinky cloth on the side of the bathtub when we arrived... for the cost of one night stay, this shouldn't be happening. 

This was our second stay at this hotel. First time there last year, we loved it. After a second stay here, I'm not sure we would stay a third time.
Positive Reviews:

Review Title: lovely location but disappointing hotel experience
Negative Reviews: Facilities like the gym and restaurants were closed and there was no housekeeping service for the duration of our two week stay. We were told local lockdown rules (introduced after we had booked) meant no one could come in our room to change bed linen or clean despite the length of our stay. As we were in Toronto for family reasons we had quite a lot to do and had booked a hotel, for comfort and ease; not self catering accommodation. When we arrived the bathroom door didnâ€™t close and the phone didnâ€™t work in our room, both required separate maintenance team visits which seemed contradictory when housekeeping werenâ€™t allowed in. It felt like no thought had been given as to how two weeks with no cleaning at all would work in practice, especially with snow outside meaning boots bringing in salt/dirt/wet each day; no cleaning products or equipment were left in the room, or bathroom and this would have been an obvious solution; no one wants to ask for a loo brush or spend time sourcing and buying cleaning products while paying for a hotel service - but we did. We had booked a suite, so fortunately it had a washing machine and they did give us some sachets of powder when we asked for it (and had to ask for more like Oliver Twist) but washing our own towels and having to have the dryer on what felt like endlessly in our living/sleeping space was far from ideal. The bath/shower drainage was blocked and took 4-5 hrs to drain, a lightbulb in the bathroom was out. With no one collecting rubbish we were asked to use the garbage room & chute in the hallway, but then this was closed so garbage had to be stored in room until it reopened a few days later. It was all very dissatisfying.
Positive Reviews: Great downtown location, close to transport links and lake, interesting building and history

Negative Reviews: Our expectations towards the room were not quite met, based on the photos on the booking app. The suite is not really a suite, but rather a large room with a kitchen. The room advertised a lake view, but the lake was hardly visible from the floor we were assigned.
Positive Reviews: The hotel itself is fine/standard and the location is great. Parking was full, but there are great nearby facilities - personnel will direct you.

If you parked from 6pm to 6am it was only 10$ total. so great if you are planning on being out all day. Otherwise day time it is a pretty expensive parking as well.

Negative Reviews: Only thing that would have been better was accessible washroom (my mother uses a walker) where she didnâ€™t have to wait for an elevator to the basement.

Negative Reviews:
When I booked my room I was quoted a price. At check-out I was required to pay an additional 17% due to taxes that were not disclosed at the time of reserving the room. 
I understand that the price at the time of reservation is quoted as an approximate. I imagined that this is due to possible changes in forex rates for example. 
A near 20% increase in cost to a customer due to undisclosed taxes at the point of reservation cannot form part of the original quoted priceâ€™s â€˜approximateâ€™. 
One King West Hotel knows exactly what taxes apply per room per stay. That One King West Hotel withholds such charges from the quoted price in order to appear more affordable is misleading and deceiving.
The additional money I had to pay at check out might not seem much to One King West Hotel but it is substantial to me. 
I feel robbed and deceived.

Negative Reviews: My reservation said I was getting an "Historic Double Suite" with stylish modern decor , and en suite washer/dryer (in select rooms) and a 4-piece en suite bathroom.   I wouldn't call it a suite at all, and the bathroom was actually quite small - hardly enough room to towel off if the door's closed.   Certainly no 4 piece bath.  On the window side of the room, two lights didn't work which I discovered only on returning to the room after dinner.   The desk light control knob had no screw - a repair person came in to fix that.   The floor lamp was unplugged so I plugged it in.   Once i was in bed, I realized the likely reason it was left unplugged - the fluorescent bulb in it continued to flash during the night - very annoying in the dark - so I unplugged and reported it next morning.    Not very impressive.

Negative Reviews: We tried three different rooms and they were clearly not property cleaned. In the first room, my pillow had yellow spots all over it and when I moved the pillow there was hair under it. There was also hair in the bathroom (this was all upon arrival, so we know it wasnâ€™t from us). The second room had hair in the bathroom, the bathroom sink was dirty with yellow drops and hair, there were crumbs all over the kitchen floor and counter tops were dirty and not wiped down. Someone came to clean and did not even bring disinfectant products, just a vacuum. We then switched again and the third room also wasnâ€™t clean but at that point, we let it go because it was midnight. It was clear the rooms were not properly cleaned from whoever stayed before us and made me feel really uncomfortable, especially having to sleep there for 2 nights and feeling like the sheets might not have been changed at all. Wouldnâ€™t have been as upset if it was just a mishap with the first room and I also get that hotels are never going to be as clean as home, but the fact that 3 rooms were dirty shows their cleaning standards are obviously low, which made the stay very uncomfortable. I would NEVER stay here again. Also, aside from arranging for us to switch rooms, they did not offer us anything for the inconvenience. The least they couldâ€™ve done was given some money back or even a credit for the restaurant or something to that end.

One of those men tried to grab something out of my wallet they thought was my room key without asking, in quite an aggressive manner. We saw them continuously doing this to other women too, but letting men walk right on by. Also, one security guard said to my friend on our second day â€œwhat, you canâ€™t read?â€ in a condescending tone. She had been told the day before to use the automatic door, even though thereâ€™s a sign saying to not use it and use the revolving one instead, so she followed this the next day and that was his response to her. Seems thereâ€™s different rules for different days and different people. Unprofessional and disappointing.

Location, staff, restaurant & cafe

I'll be honest, it's such a stylish place I was worried that they wouldn't let my in wearing shorts and trainers. Didn't have to worry about that, they welcomed everyone the same. Every member of the team was friendly and welcoming. I had a brilliant view up on the 42nd floor. For those worrying that being on the higher floors means you'll wait forever on a lift - don't worry, I never waited more than about 30 seconds. 

The hotel has direct access to the PATH network so you can from Union Station to the hotel without going outside. Same with the local food courts and Tim Hortons. I imagine that would be really handy when it's tipping it down outside.

Review Title: Hotel room from the 1980s, and last cleaned in 1980s, disgusting.
Negative Reviews: ive been to this hotel before and loved the location but i was forced into this suits in the "Historic" section of the hotel (The lower 10 levels) i found it odd there was a separate elevator to this side of the hotel, didnt like not being on a higher level with a view, but i managed as i booked the night before. Went looking for an ice machine staying on the 6th floor,  from 6 up to 10 there are NO SIGNS what so ever about an ice machine, i ran into a lady who had walked in an HOUR ago to book, travelling from Alberta, and was staying on the 30th floor lol, when I booked online the night before and made my reservations and checked in at 5pm I was told there was only ONE suite left and forced to this specific suite lol. The suite was a NIGHTMARE, i had plans to have a romantic night/day with my girlfriend and the second we looked into the washroom to take a shower we were pushed back into 1980s! the room not only looked like it was last renovated/built in the 80s with the old tiling but the disgusting mould and dirt that was filled in the grouts i had to shower closing my eyes, and my girlfriend refused to shower, when i complained about our room the staff told me the the same, there was only that suite left. The faucet during COVID looked as if no one had touched it from the last stay as it was stained and had finger prints all over it.
Positive Reviews: I have been to this hotel time after time for the location, considering it is a 10-15 min walk from harbour front which is really nice, and almost the same amount of time to eaton centre (Younge and Dundas)

Review Title: WITHOUT DOUBT THE WORST PROPERTY WE HAVE EVER RENTED, BEWARE OF THIS ONE!!!!!!!
Negative Reviews:
The entire apartment is so far below acceptable I am horrified that booking.com accepts this substandard property for inclusion in their portfolio.
Directly opposite the 3 elevators, continual and high levels of noise from shouting children and intoxicated revellers from 6 am in the morning through to 2 am that night.
Elevator machinery noise reverberating throughout the apartment 24 hours a day.
Normal waiting time for elevator 10-15 minutes, always full of families arriving or leaving holiday, suitcases, pushchairs, cannot get in  the elevator.
Filthy windows and patio glass, good view but cannot see them due to state of the glass.
2 numbers given for contact with host, spent 3 + hours trying to get contact, voice mail full. Told shortage of staff.
Instructions for the internet router incomprehensible, router found buried in the broom cupboard under the stools, broken furniture, mops, vacuum cleaner, buckets, plastic boxes, cleaning materials.
TV has NO CHANNELS AT ALL, SO NO TV. Told by host no one wants to watch TV. I DID.
Finally given password to Netflix. Had to install that ourselves.
4 various bath towels discovered in one bedroom wardrobe, No hand towels, no face cloths, no shower mat.
NO TOILETRIES ANYWHERE DESPITE THIS BEING ADVERTISED. No soap, no shampoo, no bath lotion, no conditioner,
Both bathroom extraction fans ran 24 hours a day, never stopped, unacceptable noise levels.
Not one sink or bath plug in the entire property.
No toilet rolls.
Light switch for bedroom 1 is in the kitchen.
Coffee machine had no filter papers, so cannot use.
NO coffee, tea, sugar or milk supplied.
Washing machine had no detergent, so we bought some and as the host cannot afford it, left it for the next unlucky person.
NOWHERE TO PUT CLOTHES, SOCKS, UNDERWEAR ETC, only 1 wardrobe per bed room, so live out of suitcase on bed room floor.
This building is predominantly a holiday resort, lobby ALWAYS full of arriving and departing families, cannot get in elevators.

Review Title: Not recommended for traveling with family
Negative Reviews: Itâ€™s overpriced consider the size and the quality of the room. Our first room was right by the elevator and we can hear it running in the middle of the night. The staff told us all the good rooms with a view are near the elevator. On top of that, the fridge in our room canâ€™t be opened as itâ€™s blocked by the cabinet. The TV is also broken. The staff told us in the morning they will fix it while we are going out, but it was still broken after we returned at 3pm. We had to call them again to get a service ticket opened. Not sure if that means they didnâ€™t do anything until we compliant again. TV is kind of a big deal if you are traveling with a kiddo. They later offered to switch us to a lower floor room without a view (picture#2) which is not ideal. Not exactly what you would expect for $400 a night. Even though the staff tried to help us eventually, but it does still feel like a ripe off considering the quality of the room, speedy of service and the bad service recovery plans. It feels like the customer are paying for all the inconvenience caused by the hotel. Itâ€™s a ok hotel for people who are traveling alone and does plan to use any amenities in the room, but I would not recommend it if you are traveling with family. I would pick other hotel chains instead. They are significantly cheaper but more reliable. This experience proofs that expensive does not mean better. Overall, bad value for the money. Very surprised how it has such good rating.

Review Title: MISTREATED BY HORRIBLE MANAGER, I WILL NEVER BE BACK
Negative Reviews:
Upon arrival I was told that the Suite I had booked with a view on an upper floor was not available and that they were very sorry. They said I was being placed in a non-suite room on a lower floor and to compensate me will give me a food voucher. I was very upset but couldnâ€™t do anything about this, and didnâ€™t want to cause a scene in front of my girlfriend. The manager assured me the room was not of lesser value but that turned out to be a complete lie when I got to the room and checked the pricing on the hotel website. He also said I will be given 2 breakfast vouchers worth $40 per person. When I got to the room and checked the vouchers it entitles the holder to one coffee and a croissant or pastry and the manager had the audacity to lie to my face that a coffee and croissant is worth $40 per person. I was so mad, first my room that I paid good money for was not available for no reason, and I was put in a worse room and lied to about the value of the food voucher and not compensated the difference in the rate of my lesser value room which the manager lied about. 

The cherry on top for this absolute horrible service was when I then asked the manager if he could refund my $70 valet parking to compensate for this awful treatment and he said no. Thatâ€™s how they treat there guests who they promised to accommodate for there own mistake???

I WILL NEVER BE BACK, SHAME ON THIS ESTABLISHMENT FOR SUCH HORRIBLE SERVICE AND MISTREATMENT. I FEEL SCAMMED

Also really liked the kitchenette with dishwasher with the mini-fridge, hob and microwave. Lots of windows for natural light, and a cute desk in its own alcove with windows. This is a busy hotel with a very busy hotel bar and cafe but it seems that the noise from the corridors was not overwhelming or intrusive, and very little street noise. The TV had a great selection of both US and Canadian channels, was very useful to get the local Toronto/GTA, Canadian and international news.

At busy times, it took upwards of 10 min to get from the 39th floor to the lobby.
Positive Reviews:
I had to do some work from my room so I liked that the room had a proper work desk, desk lamp, and work chair that was comfortable to sit in all day. 

I liked the kitchenette and it was handy to have a microwave, washer and dryer, cutlery, etc. 

I liked that the room had 2 arm chairs and a small table to eat at. Most hotel rooms only come with 1 arm chair and you have to use a desk chair or make do if you want to eat in the room. 

The water pressure in the bathroom was good. There was a separate bathtub which filled up very quickly.

First, we were put into a room with an interior view, and all I have to say is Yikes. the interior view is literally a blue wall that is under construction. I did double check my booking after being told by hotel staff that we booked interior view, but that was not reflected in our booking. Negative Reviews: That I was forced not to check in due to the agent telling me I couldnâ€™t without my credit card.
Positive Reviews: I didnâ€™t go and I tried to cancel because I was told at 10:00 am October 30,2022 that I had to have a credit card for the hotel to put on the security deposit. I let the agent know that my credit card had been compromised and I had been trying to reach loss and prevention to get it resolved. The hotel agent told me they would NOT check me in even though the room was already paid for unless I had a credit card to be charged for $250 security deposit. She continued to tell me that VISA or MasterCard debit was not allowed nor was a cash deposit. I told her then i needed to cancel the reservation and get my money back as this credit card issue was beyond my control. I want my money refunded to my credit card as I let the hotel know at 10:00 am that I couldnâ€™t get my credit card fixed for the time of check in. She then said that o could check in later. I let her know that I couldnâ€™t get it done by then because when talking with my credit card company I was told that it could take up to 2 business days to get the issue resolved.  The agent then said I could get a friend or relative to use their credit card for the deposit. However, they would need to have the hotel email them all the forms and releases them print them up and sign them then fax all of the forms back to the hotel along with their picture I.D.  I did call 2 friends to see if either could do it but one was at work and couldnâ€™t as they didnâ€™t have access to a fax machine or printer as the office was locked until Monday. The other friend was at a wedding and couldnâ€™t do it. My one sister is in Aruba and didnâ€™t get back to me in time to do it.  Therefore I have been requesting that my credit card be refunded as I let the hotel know immediately about my credit card and I was told that I could not check in without it. I do not feel I should pay for a service I did NOT receive especially when every other hotel allows either cash or debit cards to be used for the deposit.

A special note of thanks to Cecile Doan, who was exceptionally patient and helpful with me when we booked in last night.  She saw that I had accidentally double booked, and helped me negotiate canceling one of the rooms.  Her gracious help was exceptional!

I have never ONCE seen this policy or way of business dealing in any of my travels or bookings on this website, and Iâ€™ve been all over the world. Despite a great location I will never stay here again due to the policy and the way the staff dealt with it; with the initial manager on duty telling me if I didnâ€™t like it I could â€œstay somewhere elseâ€ at 12:15am after a 10 hour flight from Portugal. Do your self a service and avoid this place; itâ€™s 4 star rating is very deceiving and quite honestly is not deserving. Review Title: would not stay again unless they made actual updates and fixes to rooms
Negative Reviews:
I'd like to start off by saying that we truly did enjoy our stay. The hotel itself is beautiful, and has a very interesting history that we enjoyed learning. The real issue it the room itself.

However, I will say, this hotel was a splurge for us. It was approximately $300 a night, plus $55 a night to park our vehicle. We hadn't been on vacation in a while, and wanted to treat ourselves to a nicer hotel than we're used to. We stayed 3 nights, and the total cost was about $1,300. I wanted to write this review as a cautionary tale to the fellow budget travelers like me.

Firstly, the guest service is immaculate. Front desk, valet, concierge, bartenders and servers at the Teller's Bar- they were all wonderful. It particularly stuck out to me that after a night out, we entered the lobby and requested bottled water, the concierge informed us that it would be sent to our room. From there, we proceeded directly to the elevator and right to our room, where the water was sitting in a bag on our door handle waiting for us. I had to pick my jaw up off the floor from this kind of service. The management should be proud of this incredible staff.

Now for the less than favorable part... for the amount of money spend on this hotel, the room was appallingly bad. The room didn't match the rest of the hotel in any way, quality or design. I feel like this room hasn't been updated or maintained at all. There were solutions put in place to fix things around the room that I wouldn't expect anyone older than a middle-schooler to think of. The room was so severely disappointing. There was no overhead lighting except for immediately upon entering, and in the washroom, so it was fairly dark in the room. The back of the bathroom door was all scraped up and there was a molding piece on the back that was hanging off. The wallpaper is peeling in many areas throughout the room, the shoe trim is scraped and scratched and marked all over.
Positive Reviews: Historic and beautiful lobby. The staff was amazing

When my original room wasn't ready, they endeavored to find me a good alternative that came with a price discount on the cost of my stay.  While I never saw the room I originally reserved, the one I was gifted was fabulous enough to the point I used it for the rest of my trip! The Daily Ritual is a wonderful cafÃ©, and we had breakfast there every day a  no d lunch a couple of times. They offer the best handcrafted hot drinks and freshly baked croissants in town. The attendant that was servicing me was so quick to cancel my booking. Claiming if you can't get any friends or family to use their card then what I will do is just cancel. She went to the back to speak with the manager and even though I have cash to pay for my room that many decided to stay in the back behind the walls and not assist. There must be a way to get around that so called policy. Even after I said  I booked for my husband 40th birthday as a surprise and I was coming from our of town she was so quick to just cancel. I had to stop mid way and tell her NO dont cancel let me process what's happening because at that point my husband was on his way. She did not give 2 shots about customer service or even providing any kind of Solution. After finally getting assistance from a friend got to my room and why was it dirty, popcorn in the corner of the room along with under the living room tv and table. When I called to notify front desk all the did was send house keeping. I had to ask if at that point can I get late check out, it wasn't even offered. Further more eating at the restaurant was mediocre I should have gotten pizza and put a candle in it to make a big deal of my husband's milestone. Not to mention water refill was offered to ally he other patrons and not us. So needless to say  we went and found a corner store to by water since we were extremely thirsty.

Negative Reviews: Parking. We arrived and weâ€™re told right away they would not park my truck in their facility. Nowhere in the policy upon booking did it stipulate restrictions on vehicles. Upon arrival, they told me it would not fit yet refused to tell me the clearing of their parking garage. We travel to Toronto often and have parked multiple times in parking garages, underground parking and at the hospital parking unit. While my vehicle is a truck it is under 6ft. When I asked the clerk about the clearance she also could not give me the height restriction. We were forced to park at the commerce center, and pay 75$ to park our vehicle for the night. Given the price of the room, we were more than willing to pay the 55$+tax for the parking on site. We often stay on the outskirts of the city, but decided to get the downtown experience and to say it was frustrating would be a gross understatement.

Restaurant music was far too loud for the average person to eat and enjoy other company. Staff not very approachable on this. Patrons at the bar very loud as well. Is this a bar or a restaurant? The quieter upper level seating was for some reason closed on a Sunday so no choice. We ended up eating food from cardboard boxes from the restaurant in our room. Not really what we had in mind. You can hear everything in the hallway and in other rooms. The noise and movement from room to room make it impossible to sleep. I was on the 6th floor and the noise did not stop from 4:30am until 6:30am. When security finally showed up, he banged on the door for 15 minutes, and I could hear the entire conversation from my room. When I explained the situation to the front desk agent during my check-out,  she looked at me with a confused look and asked me if I wanted to speak with a manager. Why do I need a manager at this point ?!? Wouldn't it be more appropriate for you to go speak with your manager to figure out how to compensate me for my lack of sleep?
